Mrs. Jones looked at them. She saw their innocent faces and their dirty hands. She felt a little sorry for them. She realized they were just children having fun.
She sighed and smiled. She said she was not angry. She said she was sorry too.
"Sorry, Ben and Lily," Mrs. Jones said. "I was too nosy. I should have let you play in peace. Your house is very nice. And your dog is very friendly."
She got up and dusted herself off. She picked up her purse and her glasses. She said goodbye to them and walked away.

The wealthy man decided to wander in the park. He walked and saw many trees and flowers. He saw children playing and laughing. The man felt happy with his pretty leaf.
At the end of the day, the wealthy man went back to his big house. He put the pretty leaf on his table. He looked at it and remembered his fun day wandering in the park. The man knew that even small things, like a leaf, could make him happy.

very wide and loved wrapping things up. One day, Panda went to the park to wrap some of the flowers.

The beetle scuttled up to the child and said "Hello, why are you feeling sad? Maybe I can help."
The child looked up and smiled. "I had a bad day," they said. "Everything kept going wrong."
The beetle thought for a moment and then said, "Let me comfort you. Maybe a hug will make you feel better."

One hot day, the famous ice cream man was driving his truck. But something unexpected happened. The sun was too hot, and the ice cream started to melt! The ice cream man was sad. He did not want to give the kids melted ice cream.
Then, he saw some smoke coming from a house. He drove to the house and saw a big fire. The ice cream man had an idea! He took his melted ice cream and threw it on the fire. The fire went away! The people in the house were so happy. The famous ice cream man saved the day with his melted ice cream. And

he heard something. He looked around and saw two little children. They were so excited and said, "Let's go and play with the slow goose!"
The slow goose was a bit scared but the children were so friendly that he decided to come out of the barn. The children played games with the slow goose all day. They laughed, ran and had a lot of fun.
